ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic presentation with tall stature, arachnodactyly, pectus excavatum, scoliosis, high myopia, ectopia lentis features, joint hypermobility, and multiple hernias/diverticula suggesting connective tissue disorder.
Shares marfanoid habitus with hypertelorism/telecanthus, high palate, scoliosis, and vascular/connective tissue features including hernias and diverticula.
Features marfanoid habitus with arachnodactyly, scoliosis, and crumpled ears (macrotia), though lacks typical contractures.
Marfanoid features with craniosynostosis-like facial features (downslanted palpebrae, long narrow face), skeletal abnormalities, and hernias.
Can present with marfanoid habitus, ectopia lentis, skeletal abnormalities, though typically includes intellectual disability not mentioned here.
Joint hypermobility, hernias, and tissue fragility features present, though lacks typical skin hyperextensibility and scarring.
